author: daviwil
body:
This change updates the "Using Visual Studio Code" documentation to give
guidance on how to configure VS Code on Windows to use the open-source
version of PowerShell.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Let me know if I'm not using the right language for describing the open-source version of PowerShell for Windows.  Thanks!

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: /cc @hiteshraigandhi

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Waiting on Author

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Sorry for the delay.  Updated the documentation text to fix based on comments.  Let me know if the updated wording helps with clarity.  More importantly, let me know if it's unclear whether this setting is relevant to Windows.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: Shouldn't "ISE" be "PowerShell ISE"?

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Didn't notice it before, I'll fix that.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: Why do we have different wording for Windows in installation section when document on "Visual Studio Code" site has the similar title ("Running VS Code on Windows")?

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Don't know, I didn't write that part.  I'll change it to be more consistent.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: Instructions for user interface tasks (for example **File->New**) are not formatted consistently. Sometimes they are bolded, sometimes they are formatted as a code.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: OK, fixed that.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body:
In last sentence, "could be found on [GitHub]"
Line 78: Capitalize "VS Code"

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Can you go ahead and give me the rest of your feedback on the document?  It'd be good to have a full review so I can just fix everything at once.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: @daviwil I'm done. That's all I have for now.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Thanks for the help Alex!  Pushed the update.  Also went ahead and renamed all appropriate instances of "VS Code" to "Visual Studio Code."

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: @daviwil You've welcome. "Visual Studio Code" sounds better. :)

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Updated the docs based on the latest feedback, let me know what you think @hiteshraigandhi @joeyaiello @alexandair

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: You can more easily see a preview by going here: https://github.com/daviwil/PowerShell/blob/vscode-windows-doc-note/docs/learning-powershell/using-vscode.md

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Updated everything based on Alex's comments.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: Tests have passed, any chance we could merge this now to be up to date for tomorrow?  If any issues come up with the documentation I'll send a PR then.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: My mistake, the test hadn't passed at that point, GitHub was giving me the wrong indication.  Not sure what the Travis failure is about but must be unrelated to my change.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I restarted tests on TravisCI

title: Update using-vscode.md documentation
